definitions: religious or spiritual group with unconventional beliefs and practices often centered around a charismatic leader
passionate devotion or admiration for a particular person, activity, or thing among a small group
examples: The cult operated in secrecy outside the mainstream religious community
Members of the cult lived together in an isolated compound
The film developed a cult following among science fiction enthusiasts
Her indie band achieved cult status in underground music circles

definitions: process of preparing and using land for growing crops or plants
deliberate development or improvement of skills, relationships, or qualities through careful attention
examples: The cultivation of rice requires specific soil and water conditions
Modern cultivation techniques have dramatically increased crop yields worldwide
Her cultivation of important business relationships took years of networking
The cultivation of critical thinking skills begins in early education

definitions: agricultural implement used to break up soil and remove weeds between crop rows
person who prepares land for crops or develops something through careful attention
examples: The farmer used a cultivator to prepare the field for planting
This hand cultivator works perfectly for small garden beds
She was a cultivator of young talent in the arts community
Local cultivators supply fresh produce to the farmers market

definitions: shared beliefs, values, customs, and behaviors that characterize a particular social group or society
biological medium containing nutrients for growing microorganisms or cells in laboratory conditions
artistic and intellectual achievements and activities regarded collectively within a society
examples: Japanese culture emphasizes respect for elders and group harmony
The company culture promotes innovation and collaborative problem solving
The bacteria culture grew rapidly in the petri dish overnight
Scientists developed a new cell culture technique for vaccine production
The city invested heavily in culture through museums and theaters
Pop culture influences fashion trends around the world

definitions: tunnel or pipe structure that allows water to flow under a road, railroad, or embankment
examples: The culvert beneath the highway prevents flooding during heavy rains
Engineers inspected the concrete culvert for signs of deterioration

definitions: aromatic seed spice from a flowering plant used widely in Middle Eastern and Indian cuisine
examples: The recipe calls for ground cumin and fresh coriander leaves
Cumin gives the curry its distinctive earthy and warm flavor

definitions: skillful use of deception or trickery to achieve goals, often with intelligence and craftiness
examples: The fox displayed remarkable cunning in escaping from the hunters
Her cunning in business negotiations earned both admiration and wariness

definitions: small bowl-shaped container with a handle used for drinking liquids
trophy or prize shaped like a cup awarded in sports competitions
unit of volume measurement equal to eight fluid ounces or approximately 237 milliliters
examples: She sipped her morning coffee from her favorite ceramic cup
The teacup rattled against the saucer as she set it down
The team celebrated winning the championship cup after the final match
The silver cup gleamed in the trophy case display
Add two cups of flour to the mixing bowl carefully
The recipe requires exactly one cup of milk

definitions: enclosed storage cabinet with shelves and doors, typically used in kitchens for dishes or food
examples: She organized the cupboard to fit all the new dishes properly
The kitchen cupboard held canned goods and breakfast cereals

definitions: individual-sized cake baked in a paper or aluminum cup and typically decorated with frosting
examples: The birthday party featured chocolate cupcakes with vanilla buttercream frosting
She decorated each cupcake with colorful sprinkles and edible flowers

definitions: Roman god of love often depicted as a winged child with bow and arrows
decorative representation of a cherub symbolizing love, commonly used in romantic imagery
examples: In mythology, Cupid shoots arrows to make people fall in love
The Valentine's card featured Cupid floating among pink clouds
Wedding invitations were adorned with golden cupids and roses
Stone cupids decorated the fountain in the romantic garden

definitions: assistant to a parish priest or minister who helps with religious duties and pastoral care
examples: The curate conducted evening prayers when the vicar was away
She served as curate for three years before receiving her own parish

definitions: substance or treatment that has the power to cure disease or restore health
examples: The spa claimed their mineral waters had curative properties for arthritis
Scientists searched for curative compounds in rainforest plants

definitions: person responsible for selecting, organizing, and caring for items in a museum or gallery collection
examples: The museum curator organized an exhibition of Renaissance paintings
As curator, she acquired several important works for the permanent collection

definitions: raised edge of stone or concrete along a street that separates the roadway from the sidewalk
check or restraint placed on something to limit or control its extent
examples: She parked the car carefully alongside the curb
The child tripped over the curb while crossing the street
New regulations put a curb on excessive executive bonuses
The government implemented measures to curb inflation

definitions: materials used to construct curbs along streets and walkways
act of restraining or controlling something to prevent excess
examples: The contractor installed granite curbing along the downtown streets
New curbing improved both drainage and pedestrian safety
Curbing carbon emissions requires international cooperation and commitment
The curbing of free speech raised constitutional concerns

definitions: area at or near the curb of a street, especially for pickup or delivery services
examples: The restaurant offers curbside pickup for takeout orders
Recycling bins were placed at the curbside for morning collection

definitions: soft white substance formed when milk coagulates, used in making cheese and other dairy products
examples: Fresh curd mixed with herbs makes a delicious spread
The cheese maker separated the curd from the whey

definitions: treatment or medicine that eliminates disease or restores health completely
process of preserving meat, fish, or other foods through salting, smoking, or drying
examples: Scientists continue searching for a cure for cancer
The new antibiotic proved to be an effective cure for the infection
The ham underwent a traditional salt cure for several months
Smoking was an ancient cure method for preserving fish

definitions: regulation requiring people to remain indoors during specified hours, typically at night for safety or order
examples: The city imposed a midnight curfew during the civil unrest
Teenagers must observe the eleven o'clock curfew on school nights

definitions: process of treating disease or injury to restore health
method of preserving food through salting, smoking, or drying
chemical or physical process that hardens materials like concrete or rubber
examples: The curing of tuberculosis once required months of sanatorium treatment
Proper wound curing prevents infection and promotes healing
The curing of bacon involves salt and controlled temperature
Traditional curing methods produce distinctive flavors in meats
Concrete curing takes approximately 28 days for full strength
The curing of the epoxy resin requires precise temperature control

definitions: unusual or rare object valued as a collectible item or conversation piece
examples: The antique shop displayed curios from around the world
Her mantelpiece held various curios collected during her travels

definitions: strong desire to learn or know about something, characterized by inquisitive interest
strange, unusual, or interesting object that attracts attention
examples: Her curiosity about science led to a career in research
Children's natural curiosity drives them to explore their environment
The museum displayed Victorian curiosities in glass cases
That old mechanical toy is quite a curiosity nowadays

definitions: something with a curved or spiral shape or form
spiral or curved lock of hair formed naturally or by styling
weightlifting exercise that involves bending the arm to lift weight toward the shoulder
examples: A curl of smoke rose from the chimney
The paper had curls at the edges from moisture
Her hair fell in perfect curls around her shoulders
He used a curling iron to add curls to his hair
She performed twenty bicep curls with the dumbbells
Hammer curls target different muscle groups than regular curls

definitions: cylindrical device used to curl hair by wrapping sections around it
athlete who participates in the sport of curling on ice
examples: She left the heated curlers in her hair for twenty minutes
Foam curlers are gentler on hair than heated ones
The Olympic curler practiced her delivery technique daily
Canadian curlers dominated the international championship

definitions: winter sport played on ice where players slide stones toward a target area
process or activity of creating curls in hair using heat or other methods
examples: Curling requires strategy and precise stone placement on the ice
The curling championship attracted teams from twelve countries
She spent an hour curling her hair for the wedding
The curling iron reached the perfect temperature quickly

definitions: small round edible berry that grows in clusters on shrubs
small dried grape, particularly from Corinth, used in baking and cooking
examples: Red currants make excellent jam with their tart flavor
Black currants are rich in vitamin C and antioxidants
The fruit cake recipe calls for dried currants and raisins
She soaked the currants in rum before adding them to the pudding

definitions: system of money used in a particular country or region
state of being widely accepted, used, or recognized at a particular time
examples: The euro is the official currency of nineteen European countries
Digital currency transactions are becoming increasingly common worldwide
That theory has gained currency among environmental scientists recently
These ideas had currency in academic circles during the 1990s

definitions: continuous movement of water or air in a particular direction
flow of electrical charge through a conductor
belonging to the present time or most recent period
examples: The ocean current carried the boat miles off course
Swimmers must be careful of strong currents near the rocks
The electrical current flows through the copper wire
High current can damage sensitive electronic components
Please provide your current address for our records
The current situation requires immediate attention

definitions: structured set of courses and content taught in a school or educational program
examples: The new curriculum emphasizes critical thinking and problem solving skills
Teachers met to discuss changes to the science curriculum

definitions: dish of meat or vegetables cooked in a spiced sauce originating from South Asian cuisine
process of grooming a horse with a special comb
examples: The restaurant serves authentic Thai curry with coconut milk
She prepared chicken curry with fragrant basmati rice
The stable hand would curry the horses every morning
Regular curry brushing keeps the horse's coat healthy

definitions: supernatural power invoked to inflict harm or punishment on someone or something
offensive word or phrase used to express anger or annoyance
cause of persistent trouble or harm that seems impossible to escape
examples: According to legend, the ancient curse still haunts the castle
The witch placed a curse on the kingdom
He muttered a curse when he stubbed his toe
The sailor let out a string of curses
The family fortune proved to be more curse than blessing
Perfection can be a curse for creative artists

definitions: flowing style of handwriting where letters are connected within words
examples: Children learn cursive writing in third grade at this school
Her elegant cursive made the wedding invitations look professional

definitions: movable indicator on a computer screen showing where text will be inserted or action will occur
examples: Move the cursor to the beginning of the paragraph
The blinking cursor indicates where you can type text

definitions: act of reducing or restricting something in extent, quantity, or duration
examples: Budget constraints led to curtailment of several research programs
The curtailment of civil liberties during wartime sparked debate

definitions: piece of fabric hung to cover a window or doorway for privacy or decoration
large drape that conceals the stage from the audience in a theater
barrier or screen that separates or conceals one area from another
examples: She drew the curtains to block out the morning sunlight
The lace curtains gave the room a delicate appearance
The red velvet curtain rose to reveal the opening scene
The actors took their bows as the curtain fell
The Iron Curtain divided Europe during the Cold War
A curtain of fog obscured the mountain view

definitions: degree to which a curve deviates from being straight or a surface from being flat
examples: The curvature of the Earth becomes visible from high altitudes
Doctors examined the abnormal curvature of the patient's spine

definitions: smooth continuous line or surface that bends gradually without angles
statistical adjustment of scores or grades to fit a predetermined distribution
examples: The road follows the curve of the riverbank
She drew a perfect curve with the compass
The professor graded on a curve to ensure fair distribution
The test scores were adjusted according to the bell curve

definitions: soft bag filled with material used for comfort or decoration on furniture
something that provides protection against impact or reduces unpleasant effects
examples: She arranged decorative cushions on the sofa
The meditation cushion supported her during the long session
Emergency savings provide a financial cushion against unexpected expenses
The airbag acts as a cushion during collision impact

definitions: pointed end where two curves meet, especially on a tooth or leaf
point of transition between two different states or conditions
examples: The dentist examined the worn cusps of the molars
Each leaf had five distinct cusps along its edge
We stand on the cusp of a technological revolution
The company was on the cusp of bankruptcy before the merger

definitions: sweet dessert sauce or filling made with milk or cream, eggs, and sugar, thickened by gentle heating
examples: The trifle was layered with custard and fresh berries
She poured warm vanilla custard over the apple pie

definitions: person employed to clean and maintain a building
person who has responsibility for taking care of or protecting something
examples: The school custodian arrives early to prepare the building
The custodian mopped the hallways after classes ended
Museum custodians protect priceless artifacts for future generations
As custodian of the family trust, she managed the investments

definitions: legal right to care for and make decisions about a child
state of being detained or held under guard by police or authorities
examples: The court awarded joint custody to both parents
She sought full custody of her children after the divorce
The suspect remained in police custody pending investigation
He was taken into custody at the airport

definitions: traditional practice or usual way of behaving in a particular society or community
made or done to individual specifications rather than mass-produced
examples: The wedding ceremony included several family customs
It's our custom to exchange gifts during the holidays
She ordered custom cabinets for the kitchen renovation
The tailor created a custom suit for the occasion

definitions: person who purchases goods or services from a business or professional
examples: The store values customer satisfaction above all else
Regular customers receive a ten percent discount

definitions: opening or wound made by a sharp instrument or object
reduction in amount, size, or number of something
version of a film, recording, or performance edited from longer material
share or portion of profits or earnings
examples: The deep cut on his hand required several stitches
She accidentally got a paper cut while filing documents
The budget cut affected several department programs
They announced a significant cut in interest rates
The director's cut includes twenty minutes of additional footage
This cut of the song is shorter for radio play
Everyone involved gets a cut of the profits
The agent takes a ten percent cut of earnings

definitions: drawing or model showing internal structure by removing or showing through outer layers
man's formal morning coat with front edges cut away from the waist
examples: The textbook featured a cutaway diagram of the engine
The museum display included a cutaway model of the ship
He wore a cutaway coat to the morning wedding ceremony
The traditional cutaway remains popular for formal daytime events

definitions: thin layer of dead skin at the base and sides of fingernails and toenails
waxy protective layer covering the leaves and stems of plants
examples: The manicurist carefully pushed back the cuticles
Dry cuticles can lead to painful hangnails
The plant's waxy cuticle helps prevent water loss
Thick cuticles protect desert plants from harsh conditions

definitions: knives, forks, and spoons used for eating and serving food
examples: The restaurant uses silver cutlery for special occasions
She arranged the cutlery properly for the formal dinner

definitions: point or level at which something stops or is stopped
shorts or pants that have been cut short, typically at knee length or above
examples: The application cutoff is midnight on Friday
Students must meet the grade cutoff to qualify
She wore denim cutoffs to the beach party
He turned his old jeans into cutoffs for summer
